cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles SW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north through tonight, then north-northwest across the eastern Gulf; forecast to turn northeast across the southeastern U.S. mid-week and accelerate offshore of the Mid-Atlantic/New England coast by late Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / Big Bend (near Panama City – Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Alabama-Florida border to Suwannee River, FL; Tropical-Storm Watch Suwannee River to Anna Maria Island, FL and Alabama-Florida border to Mississippi-Alabama border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba; Tropical-Storm Warning Isle of Youth (Cuba) and Tulum to Cabo Catoche, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, Big Bend, inland southeast U.S., Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts (including NY/NJ shoreline late week)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (forecast 2–4", locally 6" along southern New England coast)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely 20–30 mph gusts Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor coastal flooding possible at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Friday could total 2–4 inches with local higher amounts, producing ponding and terminal/yard flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and long-period swells causing hazardous pilot/berthing conditions; possible thunderstorm squalls reducing visibility
